message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of calcifications and an acinar proliferation suggests sclerosing adenosis, which is a benign condition. Fibroadenoma is another benign condition, but it does not have calcifications. Infiltrating ductal carcinoma and invasive lobular carcinoma are both cancers and would not present with a benign biopsy result.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a 1-centimeter hard mobile mass in the breast with calcifications suggests a benign breast mass, and among the options, only fibroadenoma and sclerosing adenosis are benign. The biopsy findings of acinar proliferation with intralobular fibrosis are consistent with sclerosing adenosis. Fibroadenomas typically have more defined borders and do not show intralobular fibrosis. Infiltrating ductal carcinoma and invasive lobular carcinoma are both types of breast cancer, which would not present as a mobile mass.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a hard, mobile mass with calcifications is suggestive of sclerosing adenosis. Fibroadenoma is a common benign breast tumor, but it does not usually have calcifications. Infiltrating ductal and invasive lobular carcinoma are both types of breast cancer, but they would show different histologic features on biopsy.

We refer to Mayo Clinic for help with breast conditions. The presence of intralobular fibrosis suggests sclerosing adenosis. Fibroadenoma would have a more typical appearance on biopsy, and invasive ductal or lobular carcinoma would have different pathological findings.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The physical examination and mammogram suggest a breast mass, but the biopsy findings indicate acinar proliferation with intralobular fibrosis, which is most consistent with sclerosing adenosis. All other options would have different histological findings.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the biopsy findings points to sclerosing adenosis, which presents as a hard mobile mass and calcification on mammography. Fibroadenoma and infiltrating ductal carcinoma are also possible causes of breast masses but they would not present with the same biopsy findings. Invasive lobular carcinoma typically does not present with calcifications.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the biopsy findings suggests sclerosing adenosis, which involves the proliferation of acini and fibrosis. Fibroadenoma is typically a well-defined mass without calcifications, infiltrating ductal carcinoma typically shows irregular borders and invasion of surrounding tissue, and invasive lobular carcinoma typically shows a diffuse pattern of infiltration.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a hard mobile mass with calcifications in the breast suggests a possible breast cancer. However, the biopsy results demonstrate acinar proliferation with intralobular fibrosis, which is consistent with sclerosing adenosis. Fibroadenoma may have a similar presentation but the biopsy results would show a distinct glandular pattern. Infiltrating ductal carcinoma and invasive lobular carcinoma would have different biopsy results.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of calcifications within the mass suggests a benign condition, and among the options, sclerosing adenosis fits this description. It is characterized by acinar proliferation and fibrosis. Fibroadenoma is another benign condition but is usually not associated with calcifications. Infiltrating ductal carcinoma and invasive lobular carcinoma are types of breast cancer and are less likely in a patient of this age with no other risk factors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of a 1-centimeter hard mobile mass with calcifications and acinar proliferation with intralobular fibrosis suggests sclerosing adenosis. Fibroadenomas usually have a smooth border, and infiltrating ductal and invasive lobular carcinoma are types of breast cancer with different pathological features.
